application.name: errors
application.brief: Parses errors from a SessionLog file
application.description: This program will take a SessionLog file as an input, parse for the error groups and output a new file that contains Session Information that have errors.

history.change: Added PvlKeyword to top of print file that says how many errors the print file contains. This value is also printed to the screen.

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.brief: Session Log file in Pvl format
parameter.description: The file is a default session log file output by Isis. This file is in PVL format.

parameter.name: TO
parameter.description: This file will be in Pvl format and contain the Session Logs from Isis program runs that had errors.

parameter.name: APPEND
parameter.description: This option allows the user to decide whether to append the output file or not.

example.brief: Parsing errors out of a SessionLog file
example.description: This example shows how to get the error sessions from a session log file

terminalInterface.description: Running errors in the command line mode with the both parameters "FROM" and "TO" set.

dataFile.description: This is the input file to errors generated by running random isis applications. By default this filename is print.prt
This is the output captured in "error.log". This file contains error sessions from the input log. By default this filename is errors.prt
